duties_responsibilities.duty: Supervising daily operations of the production floor to ensure safety, quality, and production goals are met.
Analyzing the production schedule and adjusting team member assignments to meet production targets.
Coaching and developing team members, making employment decisions, and resolving issues through conflict resolution.
Inspecting raw materials prior to changeovers and performing quality checks after changeovers to prevent non-conforming product.
Collaborating with the Maintenance Department to resolve downtime occurrences on the production lines.
Completing shift reports for production numbers, downtime, attendance, and quality checks for submission to the Production Manager.
Adhering to safety programs, guidelines, rules, regulations, Good Manufacturing Practices, and Food Safety Standards.
Developing, recommending, and implementing measures to improve production methods, equipment performance, and product quality.
Monitoring and reviewing assigned team members' time and attendance for accuracy.
Working 12-hour shifts, day or night, on a rotating 2-2-3 schedule or as dictated by production demand.

education_certification.credential: High School Diploma or GED, Associate's Degree preferred
